bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: William F. Harrison was a Confederate officer with the 23rd Regiment, Virginia Volunteers, from Goochland County, Virginia.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: Letters from Harrison to his wife describing fighting in western Virginia under generals Garnett and Loring and in the Shenandoah Valley under Jackson; training and discipline; health and sanitary conditions in camps; hardships of army life; furloughs and enlistments. Two letters of 1871-1872 concern railroad construction in West Virginia.
